ygData.subject: Re: anyone playing ac
ygData.msgSnippet: I would probaly try out AC when its out. Saw the grahics, gotta get use to it.not like EQ. Not like UO. hope they resolve the latency. I rememebr the early
ygData.messageBody:
I would probaly try out AC when its out.

Saw the grahics, gotta get use to it.not like EQ. Not like UO. hope they
resolve the latency. I rememebr the early beta UO was laggy as hell. move a
few steps u ended up dunno where.

It may be a good time to join up with Freedy mail list under a local "guild"
instead of all running at diff directions(servers).

No harm trying out. how much is the subscribe ?

BiBi

-----Original Message-----
From: Sereph <garford@...>
To: <sg-everquest@onelist.com>
Date: Thursday, October 28, 1999 5:28 PM
Subject: Re: [sg-everquest] anyone playing ac


>From: Sereph <garford@...>
>
>5 words: Lag, lag, lag, ugly graphics.
>
>AC is very solo oriented so for those that like to solo in EQ or can't play
>for extended time, it's the game for you, though turbine has to work on the
>combat engine and reduce the massive lag the bloody game has.
>
>Freddy Cheng wrote:
>
>> From: "Freddy Cheng" <sccheng@...>
>>
>> anyone going to try ac... let me know... ive setup some mailing list
